description:
Google has a wide range of products and services, each of which comes with legal and regulatory risk, and a variety of external and self-governing compliance commitments. In this role, you'll assist the Director with programs that both evaluates and provides support to cross-functional compliance programs embedded in the business. You'll also coordinate quarterly meetings for Google’s Compliance Committee and assist in the creation of a compliance control framework that balances effective program governance standards with practical, creative and simple processes. You'll work on a team that is committed to developing the next generation standard for compliance assurance in a technology organization.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in compliance program management.
  • 2 years of experience with compliance program management and associated processes in a global operating environment.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree, Six Sigma certification or related process management experience.
  • Experience with a compliance control framework, including compliance testing, monitoring, surveillance and governance systems.
  • Excellent spreadsheet software and presentation software skills.
  • Demonstrated analytical, organizational and project management skills in a complex business environment.
  • Excellent communication and influencing skills, with the ability to represent the compliance function effectively at every level of the company.
responsibilities:
• Organize quarterly data collection and reporting for Compliance team meetings and share inputs to the Audit Committee/Board of Directors.
  • Assist with all aspects of execution for the Compliance Assurance Program, including risk calibration, data collection, cross-functional communication and coordination.
  • Organize efficient and streamlined risk area reporting (disclosures, metrics, reviews).
  • Execute monitoring, testing and related assessments to evaluate cross-functional compliance programs.
  • Conduct risk assessments and operational health checks for multiple programs.
title: Lead, Enterprise Compliance Assurance and Advisory
